chapter.title: Uploading Images
chapter.para: First, download some images that are known to work with OpenStack. The smallest test image is a tty testing image with a username/password of root/password. You can get it from http://images.ansolabs.com/tty.tgz. This is the image we'll use for this walkthrough.
Create a directory to house your image files.
Download the tty image into your stackimages directory.
You can get a token in order to upload images using this curl command.

Now add the kernel image to the Image Service with glance add commands. In this case we're hard-coding the kernel_id and ramdisk_id values in the third command, but for additional images, you need to get the return values for the first two commands to enter into the third command. If you remove the -A $token portion, all your images will be publicly available.

para.literallayout: glance add -A e660589d-76a7-42ee-bd52-dbd456af0745 name="tty-kernel" is_public=true container_format=aki disk_format=aki < stackimages/aki-tty/image glance add -A e660589d-76a7-42ee-bd52-dbd456af0745 name="tty-ramdisk" is_public=true container_format=ari disk_format=ari < stackimages/ari-tty/image glance add -A e660589d-76a7-42ee-bd52-dbd456af0745 name="tty" is_public=true container_format=ami disk_format=ami kernel_id=1 ramdisk_id=2 < stackimages/ami-tty/image

chapter.para: For other images, you can get Ubuntu Natty (11.04) from http://uec-images.ubuntu.com/natty/current/natty-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz and Ubuntu Oneiric (11.10) at http://uec-images.ubuntu.com/oneiric/current/oneiric-server-cloudimg-amd64.tar.gz.
